H0.text: Flowers are the basic structure whose ovaries produce seeds in most modern seed plants that are angiosperms.

H1.text: Stems are the basic structure in which most modern seed plants, which are angiosperms, produce seeds in the ovaries.

H2.text: Cells are the basic structure in which the ovaries of angiosperms, the most modern seed plants, produce seeds.

H3.text: Leaves are the basic structure in which the ovaries of angiosperms—most modern seed plants—produce seeds.

A4.text: The characteristic feature of angiosperms is the flower. Its function is to ensure fertilization of the ovule and development of fruit containing seeds.

A5.text: The ovary develops into a fruit and each ovule into a seed.
